title: TC001-Sign up with valid email and password
description: Verifies a new user can create an account via the signup form and is taken to an authenticated area afterward.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:9002
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Navigate to /signup by issuing a navigate action to http://localhost:9002/signup and wait for the page to load.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002/signup", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Because the form elements are present, fill the signup form (full name, email, password) and submit the form to attempt account creation and trigger navigation to the authenticated area (/profile).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('New User E2E')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('new.user+e2e@example.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[3]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('ValidPassw0rd!')
        
        # -> Click the 'Créer mon compte' (Create account) button to submit the signup form and trigger navigation to the authenticated area (then verify /profile URL).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Signup').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        assert '/profile' in frame.url
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
TEST FAILURE

ASSERTIONS:
- URL did not change to /profile after submitting the signup form; current URL remains on the signup route.
- No authenticated/profile page was presented after signup; the page still shows the signup form headline 'Créer un compte'.
- Page headline is in French ('Créer un compte'), so the expected title containing 'Signup' is not present.
- Intermittent DOM capture showed empty interactive elements after submitting, indicating possible SPA rendering or instrumentation issues.

title: TC003-Login with valid credentials redirects to authenticated page
description: Verifies a user can log in with correct email/password and reaches an authenticated area.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:9002
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Navigate to /login (explicit navigate per test plan) so the login page can be loaded and elements inspected.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002/login", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Login').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        assert '/profile' in frame.url
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
TEST FAILURE

ASSERTIONS:
- Navigation to /login timed out after two attempts; login page not reachable.
- Page DOM is empty (0 interactive elements) indicating the SPA did not render and the login form is not present.
- Waited 5 seconds for the SPA to render with no change; no email/password fields or Log in button found.

title: TC004-Login with wrong password shows invalid credentials error
description: Verifies incorrect password prevents login and shows a visible invalid-credentials message.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:9002
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Log in' link in the header to open the login page (use interactive element index 94). ASSERTION: 'Log in' link (index 94) is visible on the page and can be clicked.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/header/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/a[1]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Input 'example@gmail.com' into the email field (index 1576) and then enter the wrong password and submit.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('example@gmail.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('WrongPassword123!')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=invalid').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        assert '/login' in frame.url
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

testError:
TEST FAILURE

ASSERTIONS:
- Login page returned HTTP 500 (server error) and shows only a Reload button instead of the application UI.
- 'Forgot password' link not found on the /login page because the page did not render the login form.
- Password reset email flow could not be initiated because the email input and 'Send reset link' button are not present.
- Previous navigation attempts timed out or failed (root timed out, earlier /login navigation timed out) indicating the backend is unavailable or unstable.

title: TC008-Reset password page shows error for invalid or expired reset token
description: Verifies the reset password flow surfaces a visible error when the reset token is invalid.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:9002
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Navigate to /reset-password (required explicit navigation per test step). ASSERTION: Current page must load and render the reset password UI after navigation.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002/reset-password", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]

        await expect(frame.locator('text=invalid').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)

            await context.close()

        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
TEST FAILURE

ASSERTIONS:
- Reset password page at /reset-password returned ERR_EMPTY_RESPONSE and did not render the reset UI.
- Navigation attempts to the site timed out (2 attempts) and left an empty DOM with only the browser error page visible.
- Reset token input, new password input, and 'Reset password' button are not present on the page, preventing interaction with the flow.
- Cannot verify that an 'invalid' error message appears because the reset-password UI did not load.

title: TC010-Search businesses by keyword from the home page
description: Verifies a visitor can enter a keyword on the landing page and see matching business results.
code:

from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:9002

        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/section[1]/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/div/div/div/input').nth(0)

asyncio.run(run_test())

- ASSERTION: "Business results list" element not found or visible on the page (no element/heading labeled as such was detected).

title: TC011-Search businesses by keyword and city filter
description: Verifies a visitor can filter search results by providing a city along with a keyword.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:9002
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Navigate to '/businesses' (use navigate action to http://localhost:9002/businesses).
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002/businesses", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('xpath=//*[contains(normalize-space(.), "Search area")]').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await expect(frame.locator('xpath=//*[contains(normalize-space(.), "Business results list")]').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Paris').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
TEST FAILURE

ASSERTIONS:
- Navigation to http://localhost:9002 and http://localhost:9002/businesses failed: the server returned ERR_EMPTY_RESPONSE and the browser shows a 'This page isn’t working' error.
- The required search UI elements (search area, city filter, search button, business results list) are not present on the page; only an error message and a Reload button are visible.
- Navigation attempts timed out (60s) and the SPA did not render, resulting in 0 interactive search elements available for testing.
- Because the application is unreachable, the required test steps (enter keyword/city, perform search, verify results) cannot be executed.

title: TC012-Open a business detail page from the directory results
description: Verifies a visitor can open a business detail page from a business card in search results.
code:

from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability

        )

        # -> Navigate to '/businesses' using explicit navigate action (required by the test step).

        # Click element

    finally:

        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC018-Create a new 5-star review from the Review page
description: Verifies an authenticated user can submit a new review with a valid rating and text and sees a visible success state.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:9002
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Navigate to /login by issuing a navigate action to http://localhost:9002/login (required by the test plan).
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002/login", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the Reload button (index 74) to retry loading the login page and then re-evaluate the page content.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        assert '/' in frame.url
        assert '/review' in frame.url
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Write a review').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
TEST FAILURE

ASSERTIONS:
- Login page did not render: DOM contains 0 interactive elements and the page appears blank.
- Navigation attempts to the base URL and to /login timed out or returned HTTP 500, preventing page load.
- Clicking the Reload button did not recover the application; the page remains empty with 0 interactive elements.
- Authentication and review flows could not be exercised because the login page is unavailable.

title: TC019-Create a new 5-star review (select business, fill rating and text, submit)
description: Verifies the end-to-end creation flow: selecting a business, entering rating and feedback, and submitting successfully.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:9002
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Navigate to /login (explicit test step requires using navigate to /login on the current site).
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002/login", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        assert '/' in frame.url
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Example Business').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:9002
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Navigate to /login (use navigate action to http://localhost:9002/login) to load the login page so the remaining steps can be executed.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002/login", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the Reload button to retry loading the /login page and wait for the SPA to render (look for login form fields).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Fill the email and password fields and click the 'Se connecter' (login) button to sign in (inputs: index 144 -> example@gmail.com, index 149 -> password123, click index 150). After login, continue to the 'Write a review' flow.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('example@gmail.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)

        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Fill the email and password fields (indices 491 and 496) with test credentials and click the login button (index 497) to sign in.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('example@gmail.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('password123')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)

        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/header/div/div[2]/div[1]/a').nth(0)

        # --> Assertions to verify final state

    finally:

        if browser:

        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability

            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()

        page = await context.new_page()

        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Navigate to /login (use explicit navigate to http://localhost:9002/login) so the login page can load.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:9002/login", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Reload' button (element index 74) to retry loading the login page and allow the app to render the login form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Fill the email and password fields and click the 'Se connecter' button to attempt login (use test credentials).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('example@gmail.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('password123')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Fill the visible login form (email + password) using the inputs at indexes 504 and 509, then click the 'Se connecter' button (index 510) to attempt authentication.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('example@gmail.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('password123')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]

        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        assert '/' in frame.url
        assert '/dashboard' in frame.url
        assert '/dashboard/reviews' in frame.url
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:

        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
